intro: Maurocenia occidentalis, commonly known as the western maurocenia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Maurocenia occidentalis is often found in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in forest understories.
